attributes.title: Xbox Retracts Stolen Ad + Apple Apologizes for Slowing iPhones + Arrest in Fatal SWATTING
attributes.description: Xbox has pulled down an ad for PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds after accusations of plagiarism. Apple has apologized for slowing down older model iPhones and slashed prices on battery replacements. A California man has been arrested over a fatal swatting incident that started as an argument between Call of Duty players.

attributes.title: Nintendo Online DELAYED? + EA Rejected X-Wing Pitch + Spotify SUED!
attributes.description: Kinect is even deader than ever, Nintendo's Online Service might be delayed, we've got rumors about a bunch of leaked Switch games, it turns out EA rejected an X-Wing revival, Nexon blames PUBG for Lawbreaker's poor sales, The Walking Dead is still relevant, and Spotify gets sued in our first humpday round-up of 2018!

attributes.title: Uncharted Lost Legacy Director QUITS + ANOTHER Battlegrounds Clone + DC Movies New BOSS
attributes.description: The director for the latest Uncharted game is leaving Naughty Dog. Paladins is the latest free to play game copying Battlegrounds. Warner Bros has appointed a new boss for the DC movies in an attempt to save them.

attributes.title: Where is Spider-man for PS4? + Intel CPU Gaming Test Results + Animaniacs RETURNS
attributes.description: The director for the latest Uncharted game is leaving Naughty Dog. Paladins is the latest free to play game copying Battlegrounds. Warner Bros has appointed a new boss for the DC movies in an attempt to save them.

attributes.title: Where is HALO 6? + Star Citizen Dev Responds to LAWSUIT + AGDQ Kicks Off
attributes.description: 343 Industries offers an update on when to expect (or not expect) Halo 6. Star Citizen developer Cloud Imperium Games responds to a lawsuit by Crytek. Charity speedrunning event Awesome Games Done Quick is back!

attributes.title: New PS4 Milestone + Gamers Overreacted to Battlefront 2? + Getting Married to Tetris
attributes.description: The PS4 has hit yet ANOTHER sales milestone (and sold a crapload of games over the holidays), God of War's director is not a big fan of open world games, State of Decay 2 could have a release date soon, Destiny 2 is getting fixed...again, investors think gamers overreacted to Battlefront 2's microtransactions, HTC revealed the Vive Pro, PUBG just became the best-selling PC game of all time, Alien might be in trouble at Disney... and yeah, there's a lot of news. You should just watch it.

attributes.title: Cyberpunk 2077 LIVES + PlayStation Wins at Pornhub + X-Films Still on Schedule
attributes.description: Cyberpunk 2077 is coming back to life on Twitter, Xbox is updating its achievement system with loot crates, the Mario movie could be landing in 2020, Dreams is going to skip multiplayer on day 1, Japanese gamers are getting back into consoles thanks to Switch, PlayStation gamers love Pornhub, Twitch and Overwatch sign a massive multi-million dollar deal, Black Panther is setting box office records already, and the X-films seem to be moving forward, despite the Disney deal. It's your hump day news!

attributes.title: Xbox Exclusive Dates Leaked? + Battlefront 2 Wins December + CES Power Outage
attributes.description: It looks like everybody got trolled by a fake PlayStation account, a couple of Xbox exclusives might have dropped their release dates, the Final Fantasy VII Remake gets a tiny update, Prince of Persia's creator wants a comeback, the Overwatch League had a huge first day, John Williams is back for Episode IX, and the power went out at CES.

attributes.title: Xbox CRUSHES December + Surprise Pikachu 2DS Comes West! + Warner Bros on Marvel Success
attributes.description: Xbox reported a huge upswing in December hardware sales... looks like Xbox One X was what they needed. The Pikachu 2DS XL is coming west! Warner Bros acknowledges that Marvel's found success but DC can't follow its tracks.

attributes.title: NO NETFLIX for Switch + Fortnite BIGGEST GAME EVER? + AGDQ Breaks Records
attributes.description: Don't get your hopes up for a Netflix app on Nintendo Switch. Epic has revealed new download figures for Fortnite that are seriously impressive. AGDQ is over and raised millions of dollars for charity by playing stuff really fast.

attributes.title: FINALLY Buy/Sell PC Games + 120 PUBG Cheaters ARRESTED + Twitch Chat Spammer CHARGED
attributes.description: A new Steam competitor will let you buy and sell digital PC games... does Steam finally have a solid competitor? 120 have been arrested for creating cheats in PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. A Twitch chat spammer is facing criminal charges for... basically being a jerk.

attributes.title: Fortnite KILLING Paragon? + Star Wars TOO UGLY for China? + YouTube BANS Tide Pod Videos
attributes.description: Fortnite's success could mean curtains for Epic's other Free to Play game. Star Wars: The Last Jedi bombed in China... because its actors aren't pretty enough to care about. YouTube's pulling down Tide Pod Challenge videos because they don't trust kids to know that eating detergent is bad.

attributes.title: Activision Boss QUITS + Overwatch Bigger Than... Sexy Videos + No More Thor?
attributes.description: Activision boss Eric Hirshberg has announced he's leaving the company. According to one, uh, sexy viewing site, Overwatch League led to a big drop in their view numbers. Thor actor Chris Hemsworth says he's done as Thor in Marvel's Cinematic Universe. Unless...

attributes.title: Metal Gear Survive APOLOGIZES + Arrest Over Bomb Prank + Hotel Bans Social Media Stars
attributes.description: The Metal Gear Survive producer is apologizing that people think it's a Metal Gear Solid game. A TV crew has been arrested over a fake explosive prank in an airport. A hotel is banning social media stars over a feud with a YouTuber. BUT THE BIGGEST NEWS? INHUMANS MIGHT BE CANCELLED!

attributes.title: God of War RELEASE DATE + Valve FIGHTS BACK + John Cena is DUKE NUKEM!?
attributes.description: God of War's got an official release date. Valve's fighting back against a lawsuit over Steam refunds. John Cena's ready to play Duke Nukem in a new movie. and WAIT, WHAT? RYAN REYNOLDS WANTS TO REMAKE CLUE? WHY?

attributes.title: Battlefront 2 DIDN'T HURT EA? + Amazon Shoplifting Problem + YouTube Criticism Gag Order
attributes.description: EA's already fully recovered from Battlefront 2 as far as Wall Street is concerned. Amazon's opening cashier-free stores but there are some kinks to work out. YouTube's putting prominent musicians under gag order against criticism of the platform.

attributes.title: Battlefront 2 Overhaul + Grumpy Cat Wins $700K Lawsuit + View Bots Owe Twitch $1 Million
attributes.description: Battlefront 2's progression is getting a major overhaul after micro-transactions were removed. Grumpy Cat wins a major lawsuit over licensing infringements. A judge has ordered Twitch view bot owners to pay up $1.3 million for gaming the system.

attributes.title: What is Death Stranding About? + Movie Pass Drops Major Theaters + Tide Pod Epidemic
attributes.description: Norman Reedus shares new details on Death Stranding. The Movie Pass/AMC feud takes the next step, with the service dropping some major locations. The Tide Pod epidemic is getting worse. PLEASE STOP EATING DETERGENT!

attributes.title: PSN Outage + Paragon Shutting Down + Disney Sued
attributes.description: PSN suffered multiple outages, with the latest taking parts of the network down over the weekend. Epic's shooter MOBA, Paragon, is officially shutting down. Redbox is suing Disney over digital sales of Disney movies.

attributes.title: Shadow of the Colossus Reviews + Hyper Light Drifter Creator QUITS + Black Panther Best EVER?
attributes.description: Microsoft goes big on cloud gaming (again), Gran Turismo's creator confirms the next game is already being made, Sega and Heavy Rain alumni are teaming up, is the Shadow of the Colossus remake any good (duh), Square Enix loses Hyper Light Drifter's creator, we got a new Ant-Man and the Wasp trailer, people LOVE Black Panther, and more in today's round-up!

attributes.title: Battlefield in October CONFIRMED + EA Wants Battle Royale? + MCU Unsure About X-Men
attributes.description: We might have a leaked release date for Spider-Man on PS4, Rocksteady is teasing their next game (again), the next Battlefield is launching in October, Anthem's delay is now official, EA is tempted to bring Battle Royale into its own games, there's a weird link between Wolfenstein and Doom, Gabe Newell met with Nintendo once upon a time, Kevin Feige isn't sure what to do with the X-Men, and more in the hump day round-up.

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 RELEASE DATE! + EA Stocks SOAR + $100,000 Contra Box
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 finally got its release date, Switch's online platform goes live later this year, Nintendo is bringing Mario Kart to mobile, Xbox One is making lots from hardware, EA stocks are going nuts now that lootboxes are coming back, Sea of Thieves gets beta numbers, Burnout's creators have a new IP on the way, Halo Master Chief Collection is getting some updates, Nintendo confirms it's animated movie, and a whole lot more in our Thursday round-up!

attributes.title: Assassin's Creed Dynasty LEAKED? + Sonic Announcements SOON + Han Solo Trailer Incoming
attributes.description: Nintendo Labo's got programmable cardboard robots, the next Assassin's Creed game might have already been leaked, people are mad that the Master Chief Collection is getting fixed, we have a slightly better idea of Borderlands 3's date, Far Cry 5 gets an awesome season pass, we've got more Sonic news coming soon, Bungie's making MORE changes to Destiny 2... it's all here in your last round up of the week!

attributes.title: New Crash Bandicoot CONFIRMED? + Newell Denies Microsoft Rumor + Tons of Super Bowl Trailers
attributes.description: Welcome to a new week of round-ups! Apparently Activision has a 5 year plan for Crash Bandicoot -- including a potential new game in 2019 -- A Way Out's director talked about why his game is different than other narrative games, Square Enix's CEO says gamers are too focused on problems with Games as a Service, pirates finally took down Assassin's Creed: Origins, Gabe Newell talked about those Microsoft rumors, Yakuza 6 got delayed, and there were loads of new trailers to enjoy from last night's Super Bowl.

attributes.title: Dead Rising in Trouble? + Germany Investigating Loot Boxes + Dr. Disrespect Returns
attributes.description: Nintendo finally dished the truth about Mario's nipples, Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 might be real after all, Capcom Vancouver gets hit by lay-offs, Bluepoint might be cooking up another remastered classic, Horizon Zero Dawn used to have co-op, Germany is looking into loot boxes now, Konami has no idea why MGS V's secret ending unlocked, and Square Enix apologizes for that buggy PC benchmark tool in Tuesday's round-up!

attributes.title: Metroid Prime 4 News + Deadpool 2 First Trailer + Falcon Heavy Makes History
attributes.description: E3 registration is almost here, we've got more confirmation that Cyberpunk 2077 could be making an appearance, Metroid Prime 4's developer might have been discovered, The Surge is getting a sequel next year, PUBG has served a lot of chicken dinners, player customization is coming to Battlefront II, and Deadpool 2 just got its first goofy trailer.

attributes.title: Final Fantasy VII Remake Going... Well? + Sweden vs Lootboxes + AI Saves Superman's Face
attributes.description: Apparently the Final Fantasy VII remake is still going! And going... well! Sweden's looking at classifying lootboxes as gambling. Turns out AI is better at fixing Superman's mustache than CGI pros. THEY'RE COMING FOR ALL OUR JOBS!

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 Tease! + Gal Gun 2 Banned + Logan Paul Demonetized
attributes.description: This weekend might see a full reveal of Kingdom Hearts 3, based on a D23 tease. Gal Gun 2 is banned in Germany. YouTube has fully demonetized the channel of controversial figure Logan Paul.

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 News Details! + Xbox One X Outsells PS4 Pro + Left 4 Dead 3 Hoax!
attributes.description: Kingdom Hearts 3 got a bunch of new details from D23. Xbox One X is off to a stronger start than its PS4 counterpart. A Left 4 Dead 3 ARG has turned out to be a hoax.

attributes.title: Bayonetta 3 Begins + Dragonball FighterZ LOSING Players + FNAF Movie!
attributes.description: Bayonetta 3 is officially in production (and it's all thanks to Nintendo), is Xbox going to have a smaller presence at E3, Bandai Namco is all about that new IP, Ubisoft is all about your microtransactions, Sea of Thieves will never have loot boxes, Kingdom Come Deliverance reviews are out, lots of players are leaving Dragonball FighterZ already, Black Panther is projecting an even bigger weekend before, and lots more in your Tuesday round-up.

attributes.title: New Diablo Ramping Up + Metal Gear Solid's Nuke Mistake + Twitch Bigger than CNN
attributes.description: Blizzard is hiring new developers to work on a Diablo project. Konami explains the accidental release of additional nuke-related content in Metal Gear Solid V. Twitch viewership has climbed beyond mainstream media giants like CNN.

attributes.title: Labo Can do ANYTHING? + God of War Like... FIFA? + GPU Crisis Hurts Alien Search
attributes.description: Nintendo has revealed a WHOLE lot about Labo, a US Senator is asking the ESRB to fix loot boxes, PUBG's roadmap is coming soon, God of War plays like... FIFA for some reason, we're still probably not getting Monster Hunter World on Switch, there's a new Incredibles 2 trailer, and boy we're not ever going to find aliens without those GPUs.

attributes.title: The Witcher Dev vs Lootboxes + Free Games This Weekend + FCC Boss Investigated
attributes.description: CD Projekt RED is coming out against loot boxes and microtransactions in video games. A bunch of games are free to play this weekend (but there's a Steam sale if you want to pay for games instead). Ajit Pai, the FCC chairman who led the rollback of net neutrality, is under investigation for corruption.

attributes.title: The Last of Us 2 Dog Teased!? + Burnout Paradise HD CONFIRMED + Game Industry Fights DMCA Exemptions
attributes.description: The Last of Us 2 Director Neil Druckmann is teasing a potential dog companion in the upcoming game. The long-rumored Burnout Paradise HD Remaster is official and coming SOON! And The Entertainment Software Association is fighting DMCA exemptions that allow museums to keep old online games alive.

attributes.title: Pokemon Gen 8 Hoax + PUBG Features Stalled by Cheaters + Sonic Movie Delay
attributes.description: An apparent leak for new Pokemon starters is just a hoax. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is stalled on feature development as the studio addresses cheating in the game. The Sonic movie has been delayed.

attributes.title: Nintendo Breaking the Law + Half-Life is a Final Fantasy
attributes.description: Nintendo's accused of breaking consumer law in Europe over refunds. We're getting more Half-Life but unfortunately only in Final Fantasy. As 12-year-old YouTuber has been SWATted because some people are just jerks.

attributes.title: When to Play Battlefield + Aquaman Doesn't Suck + Szechuan Sauce Returns
attributes.description: EA's announced when  you can play the next Battlefield game. The early test screenings for Aquaman reveal the movie doesn't suck! So that's good. McDonalds is bringing back the Szechuan Sauce Rick & Morty made popular.... again.

attributes.title: Metal Gear Survive + Lost Donkey Kong Game + Warcraft Director Speaks
attributes.description: Metal Gear Survive's sales are down massively from previous Metal Gear games, including spin-offs. A long-lost Donkey Kong 3 game has been recovered by fans. Warcraft director Duncan Jones speaks up on the movie's challenges.

attributes.title: Future of Xbox is Cross-Platform + Moss the Game VR Needed?
attributes.description: Microsoft's CEO believes the future of Xbox will go beyond the console. Moss is out for PlayStation VR and it's a game you should check out if you've got PlayStation VR.

attributes.title: Nintendo Takes Away User Reviews + Crytek Boss Quits + AI is Better at Q*Bert
attributes.description: Nintendo launched user reviews! Then took them away. After all the studios troubles, Crytek's big boss is stepping down. An AI has defeated the game Q*Bert in an entirely new way.

attributes.title: Xbox Live Outage + Diablo on Nintendo Switch + Biggest DDoS Attack Ever
attributes.description: Xbox Live went down for a bunch of users and also exposed some user data, but it's back up and running again! Blizzard seemed to tease a Diablo game on Nintendo Switch but is walking that back. GitHub has been attacked with the biggest DDoS attack ever recorded.

attributes.title: Fortnite Scrutiny + Final Fantasy XV PC Cracked + Twitch Crackdown
attributes.description: Fortnite's under weird mainstream scrutiny over addiction. Final Fantasy XV isn't even out for PC yet but it's been cracked. Twitch is rolling out its new community guidelines.

attributes.title: COD Black Ops 4 at GameStop + Far Cry 5 Surprise Prequel
attributes.description: Merchandise for Call of Duty Black Ops 4 has been spotted in GameStop's systems. Far Cry 5 dropped a surprise prequel on Amazon Prime. The state of Washington is protecting net neutrality at the state level.

attributes.title: State of Decay 2 Half Price! + Mark Hamill in The Witcher?
attributes.description: State of Decay 2's got a release date and a surprising price point. Mark Hamill could end up in The Witcher TV series (we can dream, at least). Ubisoft is working on AI to save QA costs on games.

attributes.title: Banned on PlayStation + Every Oculus Rift Bricked
attributes.description: A pick-up artist's seduction simulation game is blocked from being released on Playstation. Every Oculus Rift got disabled... fortunately, just temporarily. Marvel director Jon Favreau is tackling a live action Star Wars TV series.

attributes.title: Super Smash Bros THIS YEAR + Game Mods on Xbox One
attributes.description: Nintendo's bringing Smash Bros to Nintendo Switch in 2018. Xbox is hiring a position to get support for game mods on Xbox. The White House has issued a statement on its stance about violence in video games.

attributes.title: State of Decay 2 Microtransaction-Free + Fortnite Blames PlayStation
attributes.description: State of Decay 2 confirms it's not using microtransactions to make up the difference in the price of the game. Microsoft and Epic both blame PlayStation for keeping crossplay locked off between the two big consoles. Sea of Thieves is holding a $100K easter egg hunt.

attributes.title: Splinter Cell RETURNS? + DOTA 2's Pay 2 Win Problem
attributes.description: Splinter Cell may make a big comeback this year. DOTA 2 rolls out a new subscription program and now fans are worried about paid-for advantages int he game. Deadpool test screenings are reportedly TERRIBLE... or are they?

attributes.title: The Witcher Joins Soul Calibur + Proof Space Changes Your DNA
attributes.description: The Witcher's Geralt is officially joining Soul Calibur VI. After one spent time in space, two twins' DNA no longer matches. We've officially reached peak Fortnite after Drake joined popular streamer Ninja to set a new record.

attributes.title: Obsession Over Luigi's Bulge + Far Cry 5 Does Microtransactions
attributes.description: There's a new internet sensation and it's... Luigi's package. Far Cry 5 is embracing microtransactions. A StarCraft pro has been arrested over match fixing.

attributes.title: Assassin's Creed Goes to Greece? + Fortnite Biggest Game EVER? + RIP Keyboard Cat
attributes.description: Happy news-filled Monday, everybody! We've got Assassin's Creed 2019 rumors, lots of new God of War footage, a new game announcement from former Hitman and Division developers, the first reviews of Ni No Kuni II: Revenant Kingdom, Fortnite is becoming the biggest game ever, Epic gave away $12 million dollars worth of game assets, Infinity War is smashing Black Panther's records already, and even more to start off the week.

attributes.title: NEW Nintendo Switch Hardware + Ubisoft Safe from Vivendi FOREVER
attributes.description: Looks like Nintendo's upgrading some of the Switch's hardware. Vivendi's takeover attempt of Ubisoft is officially over. Dan Harmon explains why there's no more Rick & Morty yet.

attributes.title: Banjo-Kazooie for Smash Bros? + Justice League Worst DC Earner
attributes.description: Xbox boss Phil Spencer's given the thumbs up for Banjo-Kazooie in Smash Bros... if Nintendo wants it. Justice League is officially DC's worst performing movie. Fortnite has taken over Pornhub thanks to that Drake stream

attributes.title: A Way Out Worth Playing? + Tomb Raider Remasters Cancelled
attributes.description: A Way Out reviews are here. Those Tomb Raider remasters have been cancelled... because it turns out they weren't even official. John Boyega wants to make an Attack on Titan movie.

attributes.title: Nintendo's Secret "Eclair City" + PlayStation Guilty of False Advertising
attributes.description: Nintendo's got a secret project codenamed "Eclair City." PlayStation's been dinged over false advertising for Gran Turismo Sport. A Street Fighter TV series is in the works

attributes.title: EA's NEW Star Wars Game + GTA Online Unfair Bans?
attributes.description: EA's got a new Star Wars game in the works... or, at least newish. GTA Online's going through a ban spree, but may have caught innocent players as well. YouTube admits it doesn't send channel video notifications out to everyone who subscribed to get them.

attributes.title: Halo 6 in VR? + Carmen Sandiego's New Movie
attributes.description: Microsoft is working on a VR component for Halo... maybe for Halo 6? Carmen Sandiego's getting a new live action movie. A Fortnite stream on YouTube set a new record with 1 million viewers... but there's a catch.

attributes.title: Sea of Thieves Hacked + No Man's Sky Returns
attributes.description: PC players are hacking Sea of Thieves and causing misery for Xbox players. No Man's Sky is BACK and it's coming to Xbox. Spider-man PS4 details are promised soon.

attributes.title: Donkey Kong 3 Teased + Lindsay Lohan LOSES to GTA
attributes.description: Nintendo Italy is teasing what might be a brand new Donkey Kong game. Lindsay Lohan has lost an appeal in her lawsuit against Rockstar over claims they stole her likeness for GTA. Rumors have been flying that Meryl Streep will take on the role of Leia in Star Wars, but they're bunk.

attributes.title: Pokemon Go Owes Fest Fans $$$ + We Survived a Space Station Crash
attributes.description: Pokemon Go Fest is paying out to compensate fans who came to the event and were disappointed. A Chinese space station has crashed into Earth... and we all survived it! Great job, everyone! There's a new law against SWATting after a death last year.

attributes.title: Spider-man PS4 Date & Details + Kojima Involved in MGS Movie?
attributes.description: We've got release date and a ton of game details for Spider-man PS4. Kojima's met with the director for the Metal Gear Solid movie. A post-mortem on the game that made $0.

attributes.title: The Division Battle Royale? + God of War Responds to Critics + Stranger Things Lawsuit
attributes.description: Microsoft's rumored to have a bunch of huge exclusive marketing deals, EA called Battlefront II a slot machine, The Division's devs are apparently working on Battle Royale, God of War's director responds to critics of the new game, Overwatch's new event finally has some details, Infinity War is on pace for a ridiculous opening, and Stranger Things is the subject of a new lawsuit!

attributes.title: Sea of Thieves Fixed? + Splinter Cell Teased? + Lawbreakers OVER
attributes.description: Sea of Thieves is trying to address player concerns, Far Cry 5 has sold millions, A Way Out's creator is already working on his next project, Fortnite mobile is banking, Ubisoft seems to be spinning up those Splinter Cell teases, Boss Key admits Lawbreakers flopped, and all kinds of fun stuff in the Friday round-up. Come get your news.

attributes.title: God of War Progression Revealed + PUBG Clones SUING Clones
attributes.description: Ahead of reviews, Sony's revealed how God of War's progression and armor customization will work. PUBG Corp is suing PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds clones... and now those clones are suing their own clones! Former BioWare boss Aaron Flynn defends EA.

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 WHEN? + PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds RANSOMWARE
attributes.description: A retailer may be accidentally offering a glimpse of when Kingdom Hearts 3 will finally release. New ransomware holds your PC hostage unless you play PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. The Korean government has handed out nearly $1 million in fines against deceptive loot box marketing.

attributes.title: How Long Until PS5? + GTA IV Removing Music
attributes.description: Recent rumors speculated the PS5 could land this year, but don't get your hopes up. GTA IV is removing some music from the game, so beware patches! The FTC is laying the smackdown on companies using warranty stickers to try to stop consumers from fixing hardware themselves.

attributes.title: Hacker FIXES Nintendo Switch Save Backups + Rampage Worth Watching?
attributes.description: A hacker has found a way to back up save games for Nintendo Switch. Reviews are here for the video-game-turned-movie Rampage. King of Kong star, Billy Mitchell, has had his high scores disqualified for cheating.

attributes.title: Backward Compatibility Key for Xbox + Nintendo Wants New Hardware
attributes.description: Xbox boss Phil Spencer's recommitted to backwards compatibility for Xbox platforms. Nintendo's on the hunt for new hardware to complement their Switch. Millions of people are deleting Facebook accounts over privacy concerns.

attributes.title: New BioShock Game?! + Watch Dogs 3 Teaser
attributes.description: Looks like 2K may have one of their studios working on a new BioShock game. Ubisoft appears to be teasing a new Watch Dogs game. Shenmue 1 and 2 are confirmed to be getting new releases across console and PC.

attributes.title: BioWare Promises Anthem Won't Suck + Using SpyWare to Catch Cheaters?
attributes.description: BioWare promises they've learned from Mass Effect Andromeda and won't repeat those mistakes with Anthem. Guild Wars 2's developers have been accused of using spyware to catch cheaters. Fortnite is NOT shutting down, despite a recent rumor claiming that to be the case.

attributes.title: More PS5 News + Wave Race for Switch + YouTube Ignores Small Creators
Pokemon Ultra Shiny + Black Ops 4 Copying Overwatch? + Valve Loses Lawsuit
Valve's New Game Studio + Final Fantasy VII NOT Just a Remake?
attributes.description: Valve's acquired an indie game studio. Final Fantasy VII Remake wants to be way more than a remake. The Witcher series director speaks on how long the Witcher Netflix series will be and when we might see it.

attributes.title: Next Xbox WHEN? + YouTubers Fix Destiny 2 + Layoffs at The Sims
Official HALO for PC? + Another Country Outlaws Loot Boxes
attributes.description: Microsoft is taking action against an online Halo fan project... but teases potential OFFICIAL Halo for PC. Another country has ruled that loot boxes are gambling and must either be removed from games or regulated. Looks like the crypto mining run on PC graphics cards are over! Shipments are dropping and prices are set to come back down.

attributes.title: Halo Online Streaming DMCAs + Gamecube Games on Switch
attributes.description: Microsoft is getting streamers banned for streaming the Halo Online mod, Eldewrito. Now that Nintendo Switch has been cracked, enterprising modders have got Gamecube games playing on the system. George RR Martin still hates you and doesn't want you to have The Winds of Winter.

attributes.title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider Details Leaked + Game Pass vs Sea of Thieves?
attributes.description: New details are out for Shadow of the Tomb Raider, but the great ship Croft sprung an early leak. Early estimates claim Xbox Game Pass accounted for as many as 50% of Sea of Thieves launch players. Twitch is doing more non-gaming content... like streaming Thursday Night Football.

attributes.title: Xbox WINS on Engagement + Blizzard's Next Big Game
attributes.description: Xbox hasn't won on sales this generation, but they say they've got it where it counts: consumer engagement. Blizzard's working on a new game, and job postings indicate what we can expect. Samsung is facing an anti-trust lawsuit over DRAM price fixing.

attributes.title: Fornite Season 4 Is Live! + State of Decay 2 Technical Beta + Han Solo’s Blaster Costs $500K
NEW Red Dead Redemption 2 Trailer + Black Ops 4 Multiplayer Teases + Star Wars Episode IX Casting Rumors!
First Look At Red Dead Redemption 2! + Pikachu Not A Mouse? + Deadpool Teams Up With Celine Dion!
Thanos Joins Fortnite + Solo BIGGER Than Black Panther?
attributes.description: Thanos is joining Fortnite in an epic Infinity War crossover event. Despite a slow start, Solo is outpacing juggernauts like Black Panther in ticket pre-sales. Good news! NASA's launching a new mission to Mars.

attributes.title: Single-Player Games "Like a Phoenix" + Prison for WoW Hacker
attributes.description: God of War director Cory Barlog disagrees that single-player games are dying. A World of Warcraft player has been extradited to the US and sentenced to prison for a DDOS attack on World of Warcraft. Bill & Ted 3 is FINALLY in pre-production. It's happening!

attributes.title: Destiny 2 Warmind OUTRAGE + PlayStation Backs Down on Warranties
attributes.description: Destiny 2's new Warmind expansion is out! But many fans feel like it's reusing too much from the base game. PlayStation's backing down on warranty stickers after a warning from the FTC. Pillars of Eternity 2 reviews are out and they're good!

attributes.title: Walmart Leaked E3 Lineups? + Black Panther Xbox One X + Annette Bening Joins Captain Marvel!
BioWare Promises Anthem Won't Suck + Brooklyn 99 MURDERED
attributes.description: BioWare's working hard to convince fans to give Anthem and its multiplayer approach a chance. Brooklyn99 has been tragically cancelled by FOX and we're pretty torn up about it. Here's when Net Neutrality protections are set to end.

attributes.title: Rage 2 is Official! + Xbox Launches Digital Gifting
attributes.description: Rage 2 has been officially revealed! Xbox is leading the way with digital gifting on console. Brooklyn 99 has been picked up by NBC.

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 News SOON? + Retro Working On NEXT Star Fox? + MORE Facebook Leaks!
First Look at Battlefield V + Borderlands 3 Skips E3
attributes.description: Battlefield V is official! Confirmed by Trevor Noah with a glimpse at the game itself, and a full reveal set for next week. Borderlands 2 is skipping E3, according to Gearbox. Will we get a standalone Lando movie? ...Yes, no, maybe

attributes.title: Borderlands 3 DELAYED?! + Microsoft's New "Adaptive" Controller
attributes.description: It looks like we have a longer wait until Borderlands 3 releases. Microsoft is putting out a new controller aimed to help disabled gamers. YouTube is scrapping RED in favor of separate Music and Premium services.

attributes.title: No Man's Sky MULTIPLAYER is Official + Huniepop TOO SEXY for Steam
attributes.description: No Man's Sky is officially coming to Xbox AND getting proper coop. Huniepop is in trouble with Steam for being too darned sexy. A new Halo game has been announced... for arcades.

attributes.title: New Battlefield V Teaser + Modern Warfare 4 Leaked
attributes.description: A new teaser for Battlefield V shows a hint of gameplay and may confirm the World War II setting. Leaks claim next year's Call of Duty will be a new Modern Warfare game. Deadpool 2 has finally knocked Infinity War off its pedestal.

attributes.title: Smash Bros Switch a Sequel!? + Nintendo Switch Console Bans
attributes.description: New rumors support Smash Bros for Switch being a sequel. Nintendo is banning cracked consoles from accessing any online services. EA's lost one of its sports licenses to an indie developer.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Ditches Dock + Nintendo64 MINI Trademark?
attributes.description: Nintendo's beginning to offer Nintendo Switch without the dock in Japan. A trademark for N64 has fans all hyped up that Nintendo may be working on an N64 Classic Edition. After Steam's crackdown on sexy games, a lot of them are moving over to GOG.

attributes.title: Battlefield V Is Like Fortnite? + Dark Souls Remastered Is It GOOD? + Youtube Limiting What You See
Battlefield V Microtransactions + Totalbiscuit Has Passed Away
attributes.description: Battlefield V will offer "Premium" in-game currency for real money. Apple has blocked Steam Link for iOS devices after previously approving it. Games industry critic John "Totalbiscuit" Bain has passed away after battling cancer.

attributes.title: Death Stranding Details UNCOVERED? + Star Citizen Needs Your $27K

attributes.title: Rockstar Changing Overtime Policies + Limited Edition DMC5 Costs $8,000 + Netflix Cancels Luke Cage
attributes.description: Rockstar Games has outlined its changes towards overtime policies after recent outcries over crunch culture, one special edition of the upcoming Devil May Cry 5 will cost players almost $8000, after the recent cancellation of Iron Fist it seems Netflix wasn't done as they announced Luke Cage's cancellation over the weekend, and more!

attributes.title: Jade Raymond Leaves EA + Oculus Co-founder Leaves Company + Wonder Woman 1984 Delayed to 2020
attributes.description: The founder of EA's Motive studio has left EA entirely, the co-founder of Oculus has left Facebook, Wonder Woman 1984 has been delayed until 2020, and more!

attributes.title: Battlefield Dev Banned from CoD + Dreamcast Games On Switch + Pirates of the Caribbean Reboot?
attributes.description: A Battlefield V developer was so good at Black Ops 4 they were banned, SEGA teases the potential of Dreamcast games coming to the Nintendo Switch, Pirates of the Caribbean may be rebooted by the writers of Deadpool, and more!

attributes.title: Assassin’s Creed Odyssey Had No Crunch + Game Pass Coming to PC + Halo TV Series Begins June 2019
attributes.description: The managing director at Ubisoft Quebec speaks out about crunch, Xbox's Game Pass service is finally coming to PC, the live action Halo TV series begins production in June of 2019, and more!

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2's Major Milestone + Starlink Has Worst Launch EVER + Alan Wake is BACK
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 is finally out and has taken the top spot of this generation, meanwhile Ubisoft's Starlink: Battle for Atlas has the worst launch for a new IP in the history of the company, and Alan Wake's licensing issues have been resolved thanks to Microsoft, plus much more!

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Beat By FIFA 19 + Fallout 76 Not Doable on Switch + Boba Fett Movie Cancelled
attributes.description: Despite the massive popularity surrounding Red Dead Redemption 2's release it couldn't top FIFA 19 in the UK, Pete Hines says that releasing Fallout 76 on the Nintendo Switch just isn't doable, in the wake of The Mandalorian's announcement Kathleen Kennedy has revealed that Boba Fett's standalone movie is no longer in the works, and more!

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Made $725 Million In 3 Days + Is Undertale 2 On The Way? + Attack On Titan Goes Hollywood
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 made $725,000,000 in only three days, Toby Fox began teasing something "new" via the Undertale twitter account, Attack on Titan's Hollywood adaptation may have found its director, and more!

attributes.title: Fallout 76 Has Microtransactions + Anthem Projections are GOOD + New Falcon & Winter Soldier Series
attributes.description: Pete Hines has given more details about Fallout 76 and its microtransactions, EA's projections for next year are great and that's all thanks to Anthem, Disney continues to expand it's upcoming streaming service with the announcement that a Falcon and Winter Soldier series is in the works, and more!

attributes.title: Ubisoft Talks Microtransactions + Medievil Remake Trailer + First Look At Henry Cavill as Geralt
attributes.description: Ubisoft's latest earnings report reveals that the company makes over a third of it's profits from DLC and Microtransactions, Sony has finally released the trailer for the upcoming Medievil remake, Henry Cavill's reveal as Geralt gets some mixed reactions from fans, and more!

attributes.title: Black Ops 4's Greedy Microtransactions + Pokémon Director Stepping Down? + Frozen 2's New Release Date
attributes.description: Fans poured onto reddit to criticize Call of Duty: Black Ops 4's microtransactions, Pokémon director Junichi Masuda mentions the Let's Go games may be his last, Frozen 2's release date shifts but only by a bit, and more!

attributes.title: Fortnite's Cube COLLAPSES + YouTube Coming to Switch? + Multiple Walking Dead Movies In The Works
attributes.description: Fortnite's giant glowing cube, known affectionately as "Kevin", has collapsed, the ever watchful eyes over at ResetEra have noticed a new icon in the suggested apps area of the NoA website and it's a YouTube app, Rick Grimes lives to see another day...or several movies actually, and more!

attributes.title: Rockstar Fixing RDR2's Big Time Bug + Nintendo Hiring For New Zelda Game + Once Upon A Deadpool Details
attributes.description: Rockstar has given Red Dead Redemption 2 players a way to temporarily fix the character disappearing issues and will be patching the glitch in an upcoming update, Nintendo of Japan posted some job listings for a new Zelda project, Deadpool 2's PG-13 re-release may not actually be so bad, and more!

attributes.title: Blizzard Working on MORE Mobile Games +Smash Ultimate DLC Line-Up FINISHED + Shrek Rebooted
attributes.description: Blizzard seems to be doubling down on mobile games according to a presentation transcript from BlizzCon, Super Smash Bros Ultimate's DLC roster has been decided, Shrek is getting a REBOOT, and more!

attributes.title: Battlefield V Devs Talk Battle Royale + First Impressions on Playstation Classic + Mario Movie Coming 2022
attributes.description: DICE gave some information about Battlefield V's upcoming battle royale mode "Firestorm", we've got our first impressions on the PlayStation Classic and they aren't looking great, and Illumination Entertainment has given us the release date for their upcoming Super Mario movie, and more!

attributes.title: Bloodborne 2 Confirmed? + Playstation Classic Uses Open Source Emulator + Avengers 4 Is Probably Long
attributes.description: From Software's new VR game Deracine may be hinting at a new Bloodborne game, the Playstation Classic is actually built on an open source emulator, Avengers 4 is shaping up to be the longest MCU movie yet, and more!

attributes.title: Death Stranding In "Polishing" Phase + Valve Making Half Life VR Game? + Detective Pikachu Trailer Drops
attributes.description: In a recent interview Hideo Kojima noted that his next game Death Stranding is already in the polishing phase, leaks show off a Valve created VR headset and mentions of a potential new entry in the Half-Life series, the Hollywood Detective Pikachu movie gets its first trailer, and more!

attributes.title: Nintendo Wins $12M Against ROM Sites + PUBG Coming to PS4 + Five Nights Movie Delayed
attributes.description: Nintendo took the operators of two ROM sites to court and won big, PUBG is finally making its way to the PS4, the Five Nights at Freddy's movie has been delayed, and more!

attributes.title: The Game Awards Announce Nominees + Battlefield V Reviews + New Spider-Man DLC
attributes.description: The Game Awards have announced their nominees, Battlefield V reviews are here, there's new Spider-Man DLC featuring a hard-headed villain, and more!

attributes.title: Square Enix Working on "PS5" Game + TellTale's Games Removed from Steam + Reggie Talks N64 Classic
attributes.description: A LinkedIn post confirms Square Enix is working on a new AAA game for the "PS5", various TellTale developed games are disappearing from Steam, Reggie downplays the prospect of an N64 classic, and more!

attributes.title: Discless Xbox Next Year? + Delaying Battlefield V Hurt EA + Final Fantasy 7 Remake "Progressing"
attributes.description: Claims that Microsoft is planning to release a discless Xbox One continue to roll in, EA's stock takes a big dip due to Battlefield V's delay, Tetsuya Nomura denies the claims that the FF7 Remake making progress, and more!

attributes.title: Artifact Pay-To-Win Backlash + Battlefield V's Big Bug + New Devil May Cry Animated Series
attributes.description: Valve fans are up in arms about Artifact's greedy monetization strategy, a bug in Battlefield V crashes the game when checking a menu, the creator of the Netflix Castlevania series is taking on Devil May Cry next, and more!

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 is FINISHED + Telltale's Walking Dead Continues + Pokémon Let's Go Is Selling Slow
attributes.description: According to director Tetsuya Nomura Kingdom Hearts 3 has wrapped development, Skybound Games announces the resumed production of the final season of TellTale's The Walking Dead, UK sales reports show that Pokémon Let's Go is selling much slower than Sun and Moon, and more!

attributes.title: New Red Dead Online Details + Nintendo VS Smash Ultimate Leakers + Skyward Sword Coming to Switch?
attributes.description: We finally have more info on Red Dead Online's beta which launches this week, Nintendo is actively pursuing those who've been leaking Super Smash Bros Ultimate gameplay and music, Skyward Sword may be coming to the Switch, and more!

attributes.title: Sony Making Vita 2? + New Parasite Eve Trademark + Kids In Rehab Over Fortnite
attributes.description: A new patent filed by Sony shows a cartridge design that could mean we'll be getting a new portable Playstation, Square Enix has filed for a trademark in the UK for something related to Parasite Eve, parents are sending their kids to rehab because Fortnite is just too addictive, and more!

attributes.title: Law Firm Weighs In on Fallout 76 + Fornite Hits 200+ Million Players + Live Action Cowboy Bebop!
attributes.description: As an update from yesterday's story, we've got word back from the Migliaccio & Rathod law firm about player's complains about Fallout 76, Fortnite has finally hit over 200 million players, Netflix has announced they are working on a live action Cowboy Bebop, and more!

attributes.title: Nintendo Ends Creators Program + Death Stranding June 2019? +  Bethesda Apologizes for Fallout 76 CE
attributes.description: Nintendo has ended its controversial Creators Program, Walmart may have accidentally leaked Death Stranding's release date and it may be coming earlier than expected, Bethesda apologizes to fans who purchased the Fallout 76 Collectors Edition over nylon bag disappointment, and more!

attributes.title: Bioware Teases Dragon Age  + Blizzard working on "Many" Diablo Projects + Daredevil Cancelled
attributes.description: Bioware's Casey Hudson teased a new Anthem trailer and something related to Dragon Age for The Game Awards, Blizzard reassures gamers that there are "many" Diablo projects in development, Netflix axes yet another Marvel series...this time it's Daredevil, and more!

attributes.title: Starbreeze Studios Fires CEO + Rockstar Defends Red Dead Economy + Rocksteady NOT Making Superman
attributes.description: The company behind the Payday series and Overkill's The Walking Dead has fired its CEO, Rockstar claims that the Red Dead Online economy is broken, Rocksteady denies they are making a Superman game, and more!

attributes.title: Epic Announces Digital Games Store + Gearbox Teases Borderlands 3 + New Captain Marvel Trailer
attributes.description: Epic Games has announced their competitor to Steam, Gearbox teases a potential Borderlands 3 announcement, Marvel unveils a new Captain Marvel trailer, and more!

attributes.title: Authorities Raid Starbreeze Studios + Dragon Age 4 Years Away + Crash Team Racing Remaster?
attributes.description: Just after firing their CEO Starbreeze Studios was raided by the Swedish authorities on grounds of insider trading, Bioware CEO Casey Hudson chimes in on the rumors surrounding Dragon Age 4, something is "Sliding into The Game Awards" which got the rumor-mill running about a new Crash Team Racing, and more!

attributes.title: Big Bethesda Privacy Breach! + Smash Ultimate Is It Good? + Soulja Boy Selling Game Consoles
attributes.description: Yesterday multiple users reported that they were receiving other players Fallout 76 support tickets that contained all their private information, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate reviews are in and it's looking pretty good, Soulja Boy is selling some less than legal video game consoles, and more!

attributes.title: Biggest Announcements from The Game Awards + Epic Games Store LIVE +  Avengers End Game Trailer
attributes.description: We take a look at 2018's Game Awards ton of surprise announcements, the Epic Games Store is live and is offering free games every two weeks, The Avengers: End Game trailer has finally dropped, and more!

attributes.title: Major Layoffs at Daybreak + Walking Dead's Final Season Chapter 3 Dated + First Look at The Sonic Movie Poster
attributes.description: Daybreak studio, famous for H1Z1, has laid off 60-70 employees who were working on a secret project, Skybound games has announced The Walking Dead: The Final Season's 3rd chapter will drop in January, Sonic The Hedgehog's movie will debut late next year but we got our first look today, and more!

attributes.title: Nintendo "Would Love" Red Dead 2 on Switch + China Bans Fortnite? + Rainbow Six Siege Ditches Auto-bans
attributes.description: Nintendo of America president Reggie Fils-Aime was quoted saying he'd love for Red Dead Redemption 2 to come to Switch, China's ethics board bans multiple games including Fortnite, PUGB, and H1Z1, Rainbow Six Siege's Auto-Ban system has officially been dropped, and more!

attributes.title: Zenimax and Facebook Settle Oculus Lawsuit + No Microtransactions For The Outer Worlds + Doctor Strange Director Returns
attributes.description: The war between Zenimax and Facebook over the Oculus Rift is finally over, after being shown off at The Game Awards Obsidian employees have confirmed that The Outer Worlds will not have microtransactions, Scott Derrickson, the director and co-writer of Doctor Strange, will be returning for the sequel, and more!

attributes.title: Epic Releasing Cross-Platform Service + Artifact Loses 80% of Players + 2B Coming to Soul Calibur VI
attributes.description: Epic Games has announced they will be making the cross-platform game service built for Fortnite for free to other developers, Artifact has taken a huge hit and lost nearly 80% of its concurrent players, Nier: Automata's 2B is coming to Soul Calibur VI, and more!

attributes.title: Blizzard Cancels HotS Events + Spider-Man DLC Criticism + Death Stranding "Nothing I Thought It Was"
attributes.description: Blizzard has announced that, due to shifting of developers, they will be cancelling Heroes of the Storm's upcoming events, Insomniac has responded to the criticism from fans over the costume choices in the final DLC for Spider-Man,  a Kojima employee has mentioned that Death Stranding was "nothing I thought it was", and more!

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 LEAKED + Fallout 76 Adding Lootboxes? + More Content Coming to Stardew Valley
attributes.description: Over the weekend Xbox One copies of Kingdom Hearts 3 leaked, dataminers may have found code for lootboxes in Fallout 76, Eric Barone, aka Concernedape, has confirmed that he and a small team will be adding new content to Stardew Valley, and more!

attributes.title: Switch Fastest Selling Console This Gen + Steam & Xbox Crossplay? + Carlton Suing Fortnite
attributes.description: Nintendo has officially stated that the Switch is the fasting selling console this gen, the watchful eyes of Reset Era may have found some references to future Steam & Xbox One crossplay, Alfonso Ribeiro most known as Carlton from The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air is suing Fortnite, and more!

attributes.title: Fallout 76's Canvas Bags are Months Away + Red Dead 2 Tops The Charts + Backpack Kid Suing Fortnite
attributes.description: Bethesda says delivery for the replacement canvas bags will take months to make and deliver, Red Dead Redemption 2 was November's best selling game beating out Black Ops 4, Backpack Kid joins Alfonso Ribeiro in suing Fortnite over a dance, and more!

attributes.title: Raimi Suit in PS4 Spider-man + Smash Sells 5 Million in 3 Days + Soulja Boy Selling More Consoles
attributes.description:
The much demanded Raimi suit is now in PS4's Spider-Man, Smash sold over 5 million copies in 3 days, Soulja Boy adds more 
knockoff consoles to his store, and more!

attributes.title: Death Stranding Coming in 2019? + Persona 5 R Trailer + Epic Made a Ton of Money
attributes.description:
In our last video of 2018, we're talking Hideo Kojima hinting at a 2019 release date for Death Stranding, the Persona 5 R trailer, Epic making billions of dollars, and more!

Happy New Year!

attributes.title: Free-ish Games for January + Activision Blizzard Firing CFO + Jack Black: YouTube Wonderboy
attributes.description: We're starting off 2019 by talking about the kinda free games available this month, Activision Blizzard cutting its current CFO loose, and Jack Black hitting over a million subscribers on his gaming channel.
